para.text: So far, we have defined the K parameter, but we have not applied it to any data set. To apply it to the Kx data set, select
and select the Kx data set. On the PEST Parameters tab, check the “
button. A new data set will be created named "Kx_Parameter_Names." Set the default formula for it to K and click the

button again as illustrated below. If we only wanted the K parameter to apply to part of the grid, we could do that by assigning the formula for Kx_Parameter_Names with an object. Wherever the parameter is applied, Kx will be multiplied by the parameter value. In this case the parameter value is 1 so Kx remains unchanged at this point.

If we had made K an HK parameter in the LPF package and we wanted to use pilot points, we would have used multiplier arrays with the HK parameter and defined a separate PEST parameter and applied it to the multiplier data set rather than to the Kx data set.
